title: Improve Gdrive remote (any rclone-supported type) UX

labels.name: severity-wishlist
labels.description: feature request, or bugs that are very difficult to fix due to design issues

body:
At the moment this is already doable, but one has to reach relatively deep into the guts: http://handbook.datalad.org/en/latest/basics/101-138-sharethirdparty.html#setting-up-3rd-party-services-to-host-your-data

Initial concept of an approach and notes on workflows

- extend `siblings` to also deal with special remote configuration, by adding a `--type` parameter that is `git-remote` by default to maintain current behavior
- by able to drive an interactive `rclone config` and use the result to automatically compose the matching `git annex initremote` command.
- document issues like https://github.com/datalad-handbook/course/issues/27#issuecomment-586127323
- rclone remote doesn't support exporttree :(
- to avoid fused annex object trees when multiple datasets are pushed to the same gdrive, `prefix` should be set: e.g. `prefix=datalad-datasets/<dsid>`
- a shared dataset annex folder can be added to a different drive, and subsequently be moved to a folder like `datalad-datasets`. This should enable a relatively smooth sharing of individual datasets (much less workable for large numbers of subdatasets, though
- an option to use a fused annex for nested datasets could be a convenient way to share hierarchical datasets
